raw_text:
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR,
Respondent,
v. CASE NO.: 70-DR-23-900051.01
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND,
Petitioner.
PETITIONER’S SECOND SET OF CONSOLIDATED DISCOVERY REQUESTS
COMES NOW, Petitioner, BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND, by and through the
undersigned counsel of record, Barbara H. Agricola of Agricola Law LLC, and propounds the
following Interrogatories, Requests for Production of Documents, and Requests for Admission to
the Respondent, CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR, pursuant to Rules 33, 34, and 36 of
the Alabama Rules of Civil Procedure.
Preliminary Statement and Definitions:
The following Preliminary Statement and Definitions apply to each of the Interrogatories set
forth hereunder and they are deemed to be incorporated therein.
A. The terms “you” and “your,” as they are used herein, refer to Respondent, and include any
and all agents, servants, and employees to Respondent including, but not limited to,
Respondent’s lawyer(s) and to any other person or persons acting pursuant to Respondent’s
direction.
B. The singular number and the masculine gender, as used herein, shall be deemed to include
the plural, the feminine, or the neuter, as may be appropriate.
C. The term “person” as used herein, shall be deemed to include, in the plural as well as
singular, any natural person, firm, association, partnership, joint venture, corporation or
other legal entity unless the context is otherwise indicated.
D. If you are asked to identify a person, please state for each such person:
• That person’s full name;
• If that person is other than a natural person (e.g., corporation, partnership, etc.), the
type of entity it is;
• That person’s last known home address and the telephone number;
• If the person is a natural person, his/her relationship (including business, blood or
Christopher Blaine McGregor v. Brittany Michelle Gilliland
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County, Alabama
Case No.: 70-DR-23-900051.01
Petitioner’s First Set of Consolidated Discovery Requests
Page 1 of 6
other relationship), if any, to you.
E. The term “document” as used herein, shall mean originals and all copies unless identical,
of written, recorded and graphic matter, produced or reproduced, formal or informal,
whether for internal or external use, including but not limited to correspondence, letters,
memoranda, drafts, corporate minutes, notes, minutes, lists of persons or things, books,
charge cards, cancelled checks, mechanical and electrical sound recording, bonuses,
retirement benefits, savings plans, stock options, and video tapes.
F. These interrogatories call for all information (including information contained in writing)
known or available to you, including all information in the possession of your attorneys,
accountants, employees and/or their firms, corporations and other persons acting on your
behalf or under your control.
G. If you cannot answer any interrogatory fully, after exercising due diligence to make
inquiries and secure the information requested, please so state and answer each
interrogatory to the extent you deem possible, specifying the portion of the interrogatory
you claim you are unable to answer fully and completely and specifying the facts upon
which you rely to support your contention that you are unable to answer the interrogatory
fully and completely and state with knowledge, information, or belief you have concerning
the unanswered portion of such interrogatory.
H. These interrogatories are continuing in character so as to require you to file supplemental
answers and responses of you obtain further or different information before trial as required
by the Alabama Rules of Civil Procedure.
These interrogatories are to be answered under oath in writing and said written answers
under oath are to be served upon Petitioner ’s attorney, Barbara H. Agricola, 127 South 8th Street,
Opelika, Alabama 36801, within thirty (30) days of receipt of these interrogatories, pursuant to
Rule 33 of the Alabama Rules of Civil Procedure. These discovery requests are continuing in
nature and are due to be supplemented should any answers change and/or need to be supplemented.
If such supplementation and/or changes becomes necessary, it is the responsibility of the
answering party to take whatever action to provide said changes/supplementation to Agricola Law,
LLC.
Additionally, these discovery requests are requests to produce copies and therefore, any
costs for such production shall be reimbursed by Agricola Law, LLC. This means that an answer
to any discovery request which makes the requested information/documents available for
inspection shall be treated as a failure to respond since these are requests to produce, not make
available for inspection and therefore, the next appropriate steps will be taken to compel the
production and/or response to said discovery requests answered in any fashion wherein it does not
comply with these requests to produce.
Christopher Blaine McGregor v. Brittany Michelle Gilliland
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County, Alabama
Case No.: 70-DR-23-900051.01
Petitioner’s First Set of Consolidated Discovery Requests
Page 2 of 6
INTERROGATORIES
1. Please explain why you fraudulently signed Mother’s 401(k) check and to which account you
deposited that check. Further, explain why you also filed Mother’s 2023 tax return without her
knowledge, and provide the bank account that you direct deposited Mother’s tax return into.
State the amount of funds for each, as well as the banking institution and account number.
Response:
2. Please explain why you were terminated from your position at Briggs and Stratton and provide
documentation of your termination.
Response:
3. Please state if you ever notified Mother that HPV vaccine and ADHD appointments were made
on behalf of Minor Child A.K. Further, state if you ever received consent from Mother in
regards to A.K.’s medical treatment, and why you failed to include her in the medical care of
the Minor Children.
Response:
4. Please explain why you informed Minor Children’s school in August 2025 that Mother was
not to pick up the Minor Children after school and provide the documentation you gave to the
school to indicate as such.
Response:
5. Please state if you have ever told a medical care professional, school official, or extra-curricular
leader that Mother did not have any authority to make, cancel, or attend any appointments,
activities, school events, etc. Specifically, for each and every medical care provider, school,
and extracurricular activity, state if you listed Mother as a secondary/emergency contact and
if you have ever attempted to hinder Mother’s ability to exercise her legal rights as a parent in
regards to making appointments, attending activities, and awareness of appointments and
activities.
Response:
Christopher Blaine McGregor v. Brittany Michelle Gilliland
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County, Alabama
Case No.: 70-DR-23-900051.01
Petitioner’s First Set of Consolidated Discovery Requests
Page 3 of 6
REQUEST FOR PRODUCTION
The requested documents are to be produced and require the answering party to provide
copies and/or duplicates of the same to be served upon Barbara H. Agricola, 127 South 8th Street,
Opelika, Alabama 36801, within thirty (30) days of receipt of these requests for production of
documents, pursuant to Rule 34 of the Alabama Rules of Civil Procedure.
The requests for production shall be deemed continuous so as to require seasonable
supplemental answers if the Defendant obtains further information between the time of answering
these interrogatories and the time of the trial of this action. If such supplementation and/or changes
become necessary, it is the responsibility of the answering party to take whatever action to provide
said changes/supplementation to Agricola Law, LLC.
1. Please provide copies of your personal 2023-2025 state and federal income tax returns,
and all W-2, 1099, or other appropriate forms and schedules thereto for said years.
Response:
2. Please provide any and all records, notes, reports, files, e-mails, and other data and data
compilations stored in any medium and any other documentary evidence of income from
self-employment, rent, royalties, proprietorship of business, and joint ownership of a
partnership or closely held corporation.
Response:
3. Please provide any and all documentation to support each response to the Interrogatories.
Response:
4. Please provide any and all documents and other physical evidence which you may use in
preparation or at any of the proceedings of this cause including any pictures of an explicit
nature or otherwise, regardless of whether you intend to use it at the trial in this action.
This includes anything related to rebuttal or impeachment.
Response:
5. Provide statements for each and every car payment made on Mother’s vehicle including
the date and balance of the vehicle, and state if the debt accrued was paid off in full as of
March 1, 2024, with documentation provided.
Response:
6. Provide any and all police reports from February 2023 to present that have been made in
regards to any altercations between the Parties.
Christopher Blaine McGregor v. Brittany Michelle Gilliland
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County, Alabama
Case No.: 70-DR-23-900051.01
Petitioner’s First Set of Consolidated Discovery Requests
Page 4 of 6
Response:
7. Provide documentation of each and every social media post, on any and all platforms, that
have been made about Mother whether directly or indirectly, including posts made by A.K.
Provide screenshots of any posts and screen-recordings/downloads of any videos made.
Response:
8. Provide a copy of the 2023 tax return that you filed on Mother’s behalf.
Response:
9. Provide a copy of the 401(k) check that was signed fraudulently in 2024 as well as the
mobile deposit that was made to your account.
Response:
10. Provide documentation of each and every child support payment made by Mother from
February 2024 to August 2024. Further, provide any proof and/or documentation you
provided to Alabama DHR in order to garnish Mother’s wages.
Response:
11. Please provide any and all documentation to support your response to Interrogatory # 7,
including a list of prescriptions filled/refilled from each pharmacy.
Response:
Christopher Blaine McGregor v. Brittany Michelle Gilliland
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County, Alabama
Case No.: 70-DR-23-900051.01
Petitioner’s First Set of Consolidated Discovery Requests
Page 5 of 6
REQUESTS FOR ADMISSIONS
The requested responses are to be admitted or denied and shall be served upon Petitioner’s
Attorney, Barbara H. Agricola, 127 South 8th Street, Opelika, Alabama 36801, within thirty (30)
days of receipt of these requests for admissions, pursuant to Rule 36 of the Alabama Rules of Civil
Procedure.
The requests for admission shall be deemed continuous so as to require seasonable
supplemental answers if the Defendant obtains further information between the time of answering
these requests and the time of the trial of this action. If such supplementation and/or changes
become necessary, it is the responsibility of the answering party to take whatever action to provide
said changes/supplementation to Agricola Law, LLC.
1. Please admit or deny that you informed Dr. Tyler or his staff that Mother was not
authorized to change or cancel A.K.’s medical appointments.
Admit Deny
2. Please admit or deny that you informed Minor Children’s school that Mother was not
to pick up the Children in August 2025.
Admit Deny
Respectfully submitted on September 15, 2025.
/s/ Barbara H. Agricola (AGR004)
Attorney for Petitioner
OF COUNSEL:
AGRICOLA LAW
127 South 8th Street
Opelika, Alabama 36801
Telephone: 334.759.7557
Facsimile: 334.759.7558
barbara@agricolalaw.com
www.agricolalaw.com
Christopher Blaine McGregor v. Brittany Michelle Gilliland
Circuit Court of Tallapoosa County, Alabama
Case No.: 70-DR-23-900051.01
Petitioner’s First Set of Consolidated Discovery Requests
Page 6 of 6
